act.title: Poisons, Opium and Dangerous Drugs Ordinance

amendments.summary: Introduced death penalty and life imprisonment for trafficking; set possession thresholds (2g heroin, 3g morphine, 2g cocaine); created S.79A offence for acetylating substances.
amendments.details: Endorsed 11 April 1984. Major punitive overhaul introducing the death penalty for drug trafficking above specified thresholds. Added S.54A (trafficking penalties) and S.79A (acetylating substances offence). Inserted Third Schedule Part III with trafficking quantity thresholds. Source available from parliament.lk.

amendments.summary: Refined definitions; amended S.35 — Director's discretionary authority for opium distribution; updated Second Schedule.
amendments.details: Endorsed 5 September 1986. Refined statutory definitions and amended S.35 to give the Director broader discretionary authority for opium distribution. Updated the Second Schedule governing opium distribution provisions. Source available from parliament.lk.

amendments.summary: Added methamphetamine ('Ice'); set uniform 5g threshold for death penalty; updated bail provisions (S.83); enhanced evidentiary standards.
amendments.details: Endorsed 23 November 2022. Known as the 'Ice amendment'. Added methamphetamine to the list of dangerous drugs in the Third Schedule. Established a uniform 5g threshold for the death penalty. Updated S.83 bail provisions for drug offences. Enhanced evidentiary standards for drug-related prosecutions. Source available from parliament.lk.

timeline.event: Poisons, Opium and Dangerous Drugs Ordinance enacted
timeline.details: Enacted as Ordinance No. 17 of 1929. Consolidated the law relating to poisons, opium, and dangerous drugs. Multi-chapter structure covering poisons (Ch. II), opium (Ch. III), dangerous drugs (Ch. IV), cannabis/hemp (Ch. V), and transit/transport (Ch. VI).

timeline.event: Amendment No. 13 of 1984 — Death penalty introduced
timeline.details: Endorsed 11 April 1984. Introduced death penalty and life imprisonment for trafficking; set possession thresholds (2g heroin, 3g morphine, 2g cocaine); created S.79A offence for acetylating substances.

timeline.event: Amendment No. 26 of 1986 — Opium distribution reform
timeline.details: Endorsed 5 September 1986. Refined definitions; amended S.35 Director's discretionary authority for opium distribution; updated Second Schedule.
Endorsed 23 November 2022. Added methamphetamine; uniform 5g death penalty threshold; updated bail provisions (S.83); enhanced evidentiary standards.

tiers.name: Minister
tiers.relationship: Policy authority: makes regulations, appoints Provincial/District Boards, determines scheduling of controlled substances

tiers.name: Director (Regulatory Authority)
tiers.relationship: Regulatory authority for opium distribution (S.35); licensing of poison sales; enforcement coordination

tiers.name: Provincial/District Boards
tiers.relationship: Appointed by Minister for each province/district; Government Agent as chairman; oversee local enforcement of poisons and drugs provisions

tiers.name: National Dangerous Drugs Control Board (NDDCB)
tiers.relationship: Established by separate Act No. 11 of 1984; enforcement and coordination body for dangerous drugs control; works alongside the Ordinance's provisions

currentReplacement.national: Ministry of Health — policy oversight; NDDCB (est. 1984, separate Act No. 11 of 1984) — enforcement coordination; NMRA (Act No. 5 of 2015) — medicines regulation overlap
